prompt: Write a poem about underpass echo in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Invent new coinages in each stanza and introduce a named creature. Add onomatopoeia and some alliteration. Arc: warning → preparation → encounter/slay → return/celebration. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
The Echo-Slorg's Roosh

Shun the underway’s deep sniss,
Where drizz-gloom slugs and zizz;
Beware the Echo-Slorg, my son,
The clap-clap words that grin and run!

He took his mumpled snicker-snack,
And went to meet the echo’s smack;
And stood beneath the gloam-dripped dome,
Where vocal wraiths and whisper-combs.

And as with sploffing whiffle-shout,
He cried a brave “Hullabree-lout!”
The Snarkle-word came zizzing back,
With gnash and flicker, crunching smack!

He slorged it with a gimbly-thwack—
The echo fell! Zound-crash! Alack!
O frabjous day! K’chow! K’chee!
He chortled in his jarggle-glee.

Shun the underway’s deep sniss,
Where drizz-gloom slugs and zizz.
label: high

prompt: Write a poem about morning fog in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Invent new coinages in each stanza and introduce a named creature. Add onomatopoeia and some alliteration. Arc: warning → preparation → encounter/slay → return/celebration. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
The Frumious Fogleer

Beware the morning Fogleer, son,
With gribbly grommits in its gale;
Bejangle not the sunbeams spun,
When flummox fogs begin to quail!

The frinkling fog-lens, sharp and bright,
He took in hand; with brollig hop,
And stood awhile in frazzled light,
And plonked awhile as swirls would plop.

And as in flumish thought he stood,
The Fogleer, with slorp-slorp sound,
Came mizzling through the murky wood,
And wibbled as it whiffled 'round!

He zazzled once, he zazzled twice,
Its grommits grizzled in the gray;
He gleeped it through, and brought it nice,
And went galumphing home to play.

Beware the morning Fogleer, son,
With gribbly grommits in its gale;
The flumish fogs are now outdone,
And frazzled sunbeams never quail!
label: high

poem:
The Gribble-Snip

“Beware the Gribble-snip, my child!
Its mimsy grin, its thoughts beguiled!
Avoid the brambled gruntle-ground
With slurpled, swishing, wibbling sound!

Take vorpal blade in hand with care,
And chuggle-swig the zazzle-ware.
Let gribber-whiff and nurple-pow
Protect you when the glimmers scow!”

And as in frabjous thought he stood,
The Gribble-snip snarled in the wood!
Frazzle-crack! It galumphed near—
He zizzled, zapped, felt prickly fear!

Its flumphing flanks he slickt with blade—
Ploosh! It fazoomed into the glade!
He left it there, its glory snuffed,
His whiffle-whack had been enough.

“And hast thou slain the Gribble-snip?
Come to my arms, my beamish boy!
O slithy-day! Caloo! Callay!”
He chortled in his whiffle-joy.

“Beware the Gribble-snip, my own!
Its mimsy dread, its hissed unknown!
Shun the becobbled gruntle-ground—
Tis slurpled, swishing, wibbling sound!”
label: high

poem:
Oh, Beware the Glimmergroove

Oh, beware the Glimmergroove, my dear!
The gnarble-grass, so green and grim.
Beware the sneeping Snuzzlesnear,
And shun the frumious frillobrim!

Hark! A supple shimmersuit she’ll weave,
With bristling bangle-boots aglow.
Her twizzle-whistle, don’t believe—
It grumbles low with grrooowwr and blow.

She took her snicker-snack in hand:
Bzzzzip! The drazzle-dagger gleamed.
And as she stood on gloop-slick land,
The Skittergloom, with eyes that steamed.

One whiff! Two snick! The snarly beast
With zizzle-zoop and flumpled thud
Fell slump, all frayed and slibber-deceased,
Its mumbly-mutter lost in mud.

And oh, the fey-folk flim-flammed free
With chitter-chatter, blip and cheer!
Beware the path, but now—oh see!
No skulk or slink brings shudder-fear.

Oh, beware the Glimmergroove, my dear!
Though grizzle-grass now calm and still.
No sneeping sound will haunt the ear,
Just sunbeam-dapple on the hill.
label: high

poem:
The Squonk in the Boardroom

Beware the Gmorkle's slankish slip,  
Where cushy chairs and coffee drip—  
Beware the swizzed and shuffling crew,  
The clack-klack-clicking hours through!  

He took his business-bladed glaive:  
The bright agenda-barnacles he’d save.  
So stood he by the oval shield—  
A woosh of neons unconcealed!  

And as the Sprell-fig monster rose,  
He whiffl'd through the chart-proposed:  
The pen went snicker-snick and fast—  
The ink-stained Squonk breathed out its last!  

O frabjous day! The team did cheer—  
With merry mimsy, doubtless cheer!  
He chortled in the glanced-around,  
Then cooled his brow on polished ground.  

Beware the Gmorkle's slankish slip,  
Where cushy chairs and coffee drip—
label: high
